items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected. 
River levels are high but steady on the River Thame following recent rainfall. Levels on the Chalgrove Brook are below the flood risk threshold. Therefore, flooding of low-lying land, footpaths and roads is expected to continue, especially in the Thame area. 
Most places are forecast to remain dry today, 22/06/21, and tomorrow. However, we expect river levels to remain high through the coming days.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are in the area carrying out checks in key areas which may pose a flood risk. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings, and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated tomorrow, 23/06/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Kennet and its tributaries from Berwick Bassett down to Newbury

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Kennet, River Og, River Aldbourne, Froxfield Stream, River Dun, River Shalbourne

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected. 
River levels have risen on the River Kennet following further rainfall yesterday 21/06/21. Therefore, flooding of low-lying land, footpaths and roads is expected from later this morning 22/06/21, especially in the areas close to Hungerford. 
Most places are forecast to remain dry today and tomorrow. However, we expect river levels to remain high through the coming days.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are in the area carrying out checks in key areas which may pose a flood risk. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings, and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated tomorrow, 23/06/21, or as the situation changes.

This Flood Alert has been removed. 
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold. The flood forecast has changed significantly. As a result, there is no longer a risk of flooding in the area. No further rainfall is forecast over the coming days. 
We will continue to monitor the situation. 
Please refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels.
